meanings.definition: A group to which a person belongs and with which they identify.
meanings.sent1: In the school play, the ingroup of actors worked together to create a fantastic performance.
meanings.sent2: The ingroup of friends always supports each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, the ingroup of superheroes had a blast saving the day.
meanings.sent4: The ingroup of musicians harmonized perfectly, creating beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent5: The ingroup of artists painted a masterpiece together, each adding their unique touch.

meanings.definition: The members of a group who share common interests or goals.
meanings.sent1: During the book club meeting, the ingroup discussed their favorite characters.
meanings.sent2: The ingroup of environmentalists worked tirelessly to protect the local park.
meanings.sent3: In the cooking class, the ingroup of foodies experimented with exotic spices.
meanings.sent4: The ingroup of hikers conquered the challenging trail with determination.
meanings.sent5: The ingroup of gamers strategized together to defeat the final boss.
